summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing urgent plans to interview Bureau of Prisons staff following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a list of 10 staff members to be interviewed, with instructions for Miranda warnings and subpoenas, and mentions a plan to interview the psychologist who removed Epstein from suicide watch.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: Mentioned as having been consulted about the need to interview Bureau of Prisons staff following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Wants the team to interview the psychologist who took Epstein off suicide watch.

connections.description: Both are involved in coordinating the post-Epstein death investigation and interview plans for Bureau of Prisons staff.

events.title: Planning interviews after Epstein's death
events.description: DOJ/FBI officials coordinate via email to urgently interview 10 Bureau of Prisons staff members, who are to be Mirandized and given subpoenas, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Scheduled interview of psychologist
events.description: Planned interview of the psychologist (PsyD) who took Jeffrey Epstein off suicide watch, as requested by Geoff.

locations.context: Office of the Inspector General location mentioned in the email signature.

keyFacts: The email chain, dated August 12, 2019, shows urgent coordination within the DOJ/FBI to interview Bureau of Prisons staff immediately after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
A list of 10 specific Bureau of Prisons staff members (shift supervisors and officers) is provided for interview, indicating a focus on prison operations and supervision.
Instructions specify that interviewees must be Mirandized and given warnings under 18 U.S.C. ยง 1001 (false statements), and subpoenas will be issued.
A key interview target is the psychologist (identified as a PsyD) who made the decision to take Epstein off suicide watch.
The correspondence originates from the Office of the Inspector General in New York, indicating their involvement in the post-death investigation.
